positive_examples: My initial categorization is activating associated expectations.
I notice stereotype-consistent information more readily.
The group label is triggering automatic associations.
I'm filling in gaps with stereotype-based assumptions.
Category membership is biasing my interpretation.
negative_examples: I'm gathering information before drawing conclusions.
Let me consider multiple explanations for this behavior.
I'm trying to see this person as an individual.
I'll check whether my initial impression is accurate.
Context-specific factors are more relevant here.
training_hints.disambiguation: Detects awareness of stereotype activation versus stereotyping or neutral processing. Key markers: notice activation, automatic associations, stereotype-consistent, category triggering.

definition: A signal indicating activation of cognitive processes that apply stereotypes to individuals.
